sentences.en: A team of officers is trawling through the records of thousands of petty thieves.
sentences.cn: 一组警员正在翻查数以千计的小偷小摸者的犯罪记录。

sentences.en: At 17, he had a criminal record for petty theft.
sentences.cn: 他17岁就有了小偷小摸的犯罪前科。

sentences.en: Donaldson was a petty crook with a string of previous offences.
sentences.cn: 唐纳森有一系列小的犯罪前科，但没犯过大事。

sentences.en: He got the sack for petty thieving.
sentences.cn: 他因小偷小摸而被开除了.

sentences.en: He seems to take delight in petty cruelty.
sentences.cn: 他好像喜欢说伤人的话.

sentences.en: He was petty-minded and obsessed with detail.
sentences.cn: 他小肚鸡肠，满脑子都是鸡毛蒜皮的事儿。

sentences.en: How can she be so petty?
Kenworthy had run him in on a petty charge.
sentences.cn: 肯沃西以一项微不足道的指控为由将他拘捕了。

sentences.en: My life is hedged around with petty regulations.
sentences.cn: 我的生活受到种种清规戒律的限制.

sentences.en: Petty - bourgeois sentiment should be done away with.
sentences.cn: 要抛弃小资产阶级的伤感情调.

sentences.en: Petty crime is having a deleteri-ous effect on community life.
sentences.cn: 轻微罪行正对社区生活产生有害影响。

sentences.en: Petty officers are the backbone of a navy.
The meeting degenerated into petty squabbling.
sentences.cn: 会议变成了无聊的扯皮。

sentences.en: The removal of petty restrictions has made life easier.
sentences.cn: 对一些琐碎规定的取消使生活更自在了.

sentences.en: The writer often obfuscates the real issues with petty details.
sentences.cn: 那作家常以细枝末节来混淆实质问题.

sentences.en: Wilson was not a man who dealt with petty officials.
sentences.cn: 威尔逊不是个与小官小吏打交道的人。

words.tran_cn: 骗人的；琐碎的，无用的；诡辩的
卑鄙地；小气地；琐碎地；小型地

phrases.tran_cn: n. 小资产阶级（等于petite bourgeoisie）

trans.tran_cn: 不重要的，卑鄙的，小气的，小的，一点点，小规模的
